pullrequest.title: simbody contact manager integration for issue #865

content.raw: I'm worried about this computation of `offset1`. This would be right if getContactPoint() returned a point measured from the link 2 origin and expressed in the world (ground) frame. But according to the documentation (and usage in the contact playground example), that point is measured in the world frame. In that case the offset should be `pose1.pos - detail.getContactPoint()`. That is only the same as coded here if `pos2.pos=(0,0,0)`.
content.html: I'm worried about this computation of offset1. This would be right if getContactPoint() returned a point measured from the link 2 origin and expressed in the world (ground) frame. But according to the documentation (and usage in the contact playground example), that point is measured in the world frame. In that case the offset should be pose1.pos - detail.getContactPoint(). That is only the same as coded here if pos2.pos=(0,0,0).
